news_items.content: Here's the rewritten version of the news without duplicates:
A major incident in Yercaud Express occurred when an alert loco pilot foiled a derailment bid on the train. The train was placed on tracks with an iron rod to prevent any potential damage.
In other news, Madras High Court Judge V.S. Manavathasan penned a poem for unity between Tenkalai and Vadakalai sects of Vaishnavites.
Chennai received heavy rainfall in Coimbatore River due to strong winds coming from Kerala and the Nilgiris, leading to flood alerts in Bhavani dam area.
A court case involving a police officer was heard by Madras High Court judges. They issued summons to an AIADMK party MLA regarding a minor abduction case.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi departed for Croatia after concluding his visit in Canada, marking the end of it.

Technology news saw Sam Altman announcing that Meta offered $100 million bonuses to employees at OpenAI. Additionally, Meta CEO is warning about potential job cuts in the future due to AI's growing capabilities.
A disavowed photography movement claimed AI is responsible for spreading misinformation. They are calling on people to stay away from AI-based content creators.
The Pope took on artificial intelligence, stating it poses a threat to humanity. A deal between Amazon and Informatica was signed, with $8 billion in revenue expected.
Artificial intelligence is becoming more prevalent in various industries. Wall Street is focusing on data centers built around AI technology.
A Latin American country plans to launch its own AI model in September. Meanwhile, Amazon's corporate workforce may see a decline due to the increasing use of AI tasks.
Amazon boss Sam Altman stated that AI will replace jobs at tech giant Meta. A comic book artist warned that AI is 'threatening livelihoods' and called for better compensation for their work.

Researchers from MIT founded Themis AI, which aims to quantify uncertainty in AI models and address knowledge gaps. The company also released a chatbot tool where users can pay $50 a month for their feedback on AI models.
A new app was launched by Meta that allows users to 'discover' people's bizarrely personal conversations.
